intro: Gnidia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to elliptic. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its woody stems and simple leaves make it a distinctive member of its family. Gnidia heterophylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
